\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{laugh down} nakukx -- bAyimucicxsu, sumamxnirisu, sumamxnAgisu. 
\num{5} \eng{laugh off (embarrassment etc.)} (saMkoVca, mujugara, peVcATa, \mo vanunx) nakukx -- kaLe, nivArisu, pariharisu, tolagisu, hoVgalADisu.

\num{4} \eng{laugh in (}\engit{or} \eng{up) one's sleeve} oLagoLageV, tanonxLageV -- nagu, vinoVdapaDu; mareyalilx, guTATxgi -- nagu: \eng{the gods laugh in their sleeve to watch man doubt and fear} mAnavanu shaMkisuvudanUnx hedaruvudanUnx noVDi deVvategaLu oLagoLageV nagutAtxre.

\bentry
\word[law(1)]{law}
\pron{lA}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} nAYxyashAsana; vidhinibaMdhane; nAyxyasaMhite; kAnUnusaMhite; kAnUnu kaTaTxLe; oMdu samAjavu anusarisalu badadhxveMdu aMgiVkarisiruva, shAsanasaBeyiMda racitavAda athavA saMparxdAyarUDhiyiMda sidadhxvAda niyamagaLu, kaTaTxLegaLu, rivAjugaLu yA avugaLa mUtaRrUpa: \eng{the law forbids, allows} kAnUnu niSeVdhisutatxde, avakAsha koDutatxde. \eng{the law of the land} nADina kAnUnu; deVshada nAYxyashAsana. \eng{forbidden under the Indian law} BAratada kAnUnina parxkAra niSeVdhisalAgide. 
\num{2} vidhi; niyama; kaTaTxLe; kAnUnu; kAyide; nAyxyashAsanada oMdu niyama. 
\num{3} kAnUnugaLa -- niyaMtarxNa shakitx, adhikAra, parxBAva. 
\num{4} kAnUnupAlane; samAjada nAyxyaparipAlita sithxti; nAyxyaparipAlane; nAyxyada bagegx gwrava, BayaBakitx: \eng{law and order} kAnUnu vayxvasethx; nAyxya paripAlane matutx shisutx; shAsana matutx vayxvasethx. 
\num{5} nAyxyashAsatxrX; vidhishAsatxrX; vayxvahAra dhamaRshAsatxrX; sAmAjika vayxvasethxyAgi yA adhayxyanada viSayavAgi kAnUnugaLa saMhite, samUha: \eng{learned in the law} nAyxyashAsatxrX parxviVNa, pariNata; nAyxyashAsatxrXdalilx visheVSa jAcnxna paDeda. \eng{read law} nAyxyashAsatxrX Odu; kAnUnugaLanunx, kAyidegaLanunx aBAyxsa mADu. 
\num{6} nAyxyashAsatxrXda -- oMdu viBAga, shAKe; nidiRSaTx shAKege saMbaMdhapaTaTx kAnUnugaLu, kAyidegaLu: \eng{commercial law} vANijayx nAyxyashAsatxrX. \eng{law of contract} karAru -- kAyide, nAyxya, kAnUnu; karArige saMbaMdhisida kAyide. 
\num{7} kAnUnu; kaTaTxpapxNe; nibaRMdhakokxLapaDisuva, badadhxpaDisuva, kaTuTxmADuva -- shakitx, bala: \eng{their word is law} avara mAteV kAnUnu. 
\num{8} vakiVli; nAyxyavaqtitx; nAyxyavAdi vaqtitx, (\sA) \eng{the law} vakiVla vaqtitx. \eng{bred to the law} vakiVlavaqtitxge tarapeVtu paDeda. 
\num{9} (\AmA) poliVsaru; kAnUnu rakaSxkaru: \eng{the law} poliVsaru. 
\num{10} (dhamaR yA neYtika nAyxyakekx eduru padavAgi) kAnUnunAyxya; shAsana nAyxya; shAsanasaBeyiMda aMgiVkaqtavAda matutx loVka vayxvahAradalilx rUDhiyiMda opipxruva, nAyxya. 
\num{11} (\bava dalilx) = \hyperref{kandict_j.pdf}{J}{jurisprudence}{jurisprudence}. 
\num{12} koVTuR parihAra; kAnUnu (mUlakada) parihAra. 
\num{13} parihAra koVTuR; parihAra (koDuva) nAyxyAlaya. 
\num{14} koVTuR vayxvahAra; nAyxyasAthxnadalilx kaTaTxLe, vayxvahAra: \eng{go to law} koVTiRge hoVgu; KaTelxhAku; dAvA hAku; kAnUnu, kAyide -- karxma jarugisu. 
\num{15} (ATa, jiVvanaraMga, kalAvidhAna, \mo vugaLalilxna) niyama; riVti; rivAju; karxma; vidhAna; naDavaLike; kAyaRvidhi; kAyaR naDesuva niyama yA riVti. 
\num{16} parxkaqti, nisagaR -- niyama; nisagaRda karxmabadadhxte, niyatate; parxkaqtiya GaTanegaLalilxna niyamAnusaraNe: \eng{where they saw chance, we see law} avaru Akasimxka eMdu kaMDudaralilx nAvu (parxkaqti) niyamavanunx kANutetxVve. \eng{the law of nature} parxkaqti niyama. 
\num{17} sUtarx; vidhi; nimaya; (\kanmu) nidiRSaTx parisithxtigaLa, GaTanegaLa saraNiyalilx kaMDubaruva, niyatavAda anukarxmavanunx yA saMbaMdhavanunx tiLisuva, sUtarxbadadhxvAda yA vivaraNAtamxkavAda nirUpaNe: \eng{the law of gravitation} gurutAvxkaSaRNa sUtarx. \eng{Newton's law} nUyxTananxna sUtarx, niyama. 
\num{18} deVvAdeVshagaLu; dhamaRsaMhite; beYbalilxnalilx yA itara mUlagaLalilx parxkaTavAda deYvAjecnxgaLu, BagavadupadeVshagaLu.

\num{20} nAyxyapadadhxti; nAyxyavayxvasethx: \eng{court of law} nAyxyasAthxna; nAyxyAlaya; nAyxya kaceVri.

\num{3} (vAsasathxLa, hAjarAti, kelasa, saMsethx, hudedx, \mo vanunx) biDu; tayxjisu; tore (\akirx\ saha): \eng{has left the school} shAleyanunx biTuTxhoVda; shAlege hAjarAgutitxlalx. \eng{I am leaving for another firm} nAnu beVroMdu kaMpani seVralu (idanunx) biDutitxdedxVne.

\banum
\alnum{a} (tegedukoMDu barade yA hoVgade) tayxjisi hoVgu; biTuTx hoVgu: \eng{I have left behind my keys} nAnu biVgada keYgaLanunx biTuTx baMdidedxVne. \eng{this suitcase I must leave behind} I sUTfkeVsanunx nAnu hiMde biTuTx hoVgabeVku.

\alnum{c} niMtuhoVgu; aMtayxvAgu; nilulx; mugiyu; konegANu; konemuTuTx: \eng{here the printed story leaves off} ililxge sariyAgi mudirxtavAda kathe niMtuhoVgutatxde.

\numie
\num{4} \eng{leave out} (seVrisade) biTuTxbiDu; keYbiDu. 
\num{5} \eng{leave over} (\birx) (sadayxkekx) biTaTxru; (tAtAkxlikavAgi) nililxsiru: \eng{the matter might be left over for the present} sadayxkekx A viSayavanunx keY biDabahudu. 
\num{6} \eng{leave undone} mADade hAgeyeV -- uLisu, biDu. 
\num{7} \eng{leave unsaid} heVLade, parxsAtxpisade hAgeyeV biDu. 
\num{8} \eng{left luggage} biTaTx lageVju; (savxlapxkAlada taruvAya matetx paDeyuvaMte, \kanmu\ reYlevx nilAdxNadalilx) biTuTx hoVda lageVju, sAmAnu saraMjAmu; tAtAkxlikavAgi iTuTx hoVda sAmAnu.

\noindent

\alnum{b} soVlisalapxDu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{have left} uLidiru: \eng{has no friends left} senxVhitaru yArU uLidilalx. 
\num{5} \eng{leave a bad taste in the mouth} (anuBavagaLa \vi) kahi (anuBava) uLisi hoVgu; (taruvAya) heVsige, koVpa, nAcike, \mo\ BAvagaLanunx uMTumADu. 
\num{6} \eng{leave a} \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{card(3) nuga(8)}{$^3$card on} baMdidudxdAgi tiLisu; BeVTi ciVTi biTuTxbaru. 
\numi{7} \eng{leave alone} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (oMdara) goVjige, goDavege, taMTege hoVgadiru: \eng{leave that paper alone} A kAgadada taMTege hoVgabeVDa. \eng{afraid that she would be left alone} tananxnunx oMTiyAgi biTuTxhoVgabahudeMba BayadiMda. \eng{leave the beer alone tonight} I rAtirx biyarina taMTege hoVdiVye; I rAtirx biyarf muTaTxbeVDa. 
\alnum{b} (oMdaroDane) vayxvahAra naDesadiru. 
\alnum{c} aDiDxpaDisadiru; naDuve tale hAkadiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{leave a person cool (}\engit{or} \eng{cold)} idu nananxnunx savxlapxvU utAsxhagoLisuvudilalx, udevxVgagoLisuvudilalx. 
\hypertarget{leave(1)nuga9}{}

\banum

\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{leave be} (\AmA) toMdare mADadiru; madheyx parxveVshisadiru, tale hAkadiru. 
\num{11} \eng{leave go} (\AmA) hiDita, niyaMtarxNa -- saDilisu. 
\num{12} \eng{leave in the lurch} naDuniVrinalilx keYbiDu; kaSaTxdalilx -- tore, keYbiDu. 
\num{13} \eng{leave it at that} (\AmA) A mAtanunx yA viSayavanunx yA kelasavanunx -- alilxgeV biDu, aSaTxkekxV biDu; matetxVnU mADahoVgabeVDa; inUnx hecucx adanunx TiVkisabeVDa. 
\num{14} \eng{leave much (}\engit{or} \eng{a lot etc.) to be desired} savxlapxvU taqpitxkaravAgilalxdiru; tiVra ataqpitxkaravAgiru: \eng{his performance leaves much to be desired} avana kelasadalilx bahaLa korategaLu tuMbive; avana kelasa savxlapxvU taqpitxkaravAgilalx, cenAnxgilalx.

\expl{(\tara\ \eng{more like}, \tama\ \eng{most like} viraLavAgi \kAparx\ \tara\ \eng{liker}, \tama\ \eng{likest}).}  
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aMtaha; aMtha; sadaqsha; adeV -- riVtiya, bageya; beVroMdu vasutxvina kelavu yA elAlx guNagaLanunx hoMdiruva: \eng{in like manner} aMteyeV; adeV riVtiyalilx. \eng{as like as two peas} eraDu baTANi kALugaLaMte oMdeV bageyAgi. \eng{very like her brother} bahaLavAgi tananx aNaNxnaMte. \eng{on this and the like topics} I matutx iMtha viSayagaLa meVle. 
\num{2} aMtaha; hoVluva; sadaqsha; aMte kANisuva, toVruva; hoVlikeyuLaLx: \eng{looks like rabbits} molagaLaMte kANisutatxde; molagaLirabeVku. 
\num{3} samAna vagaRda; oMdeV vagaRkekx, viBAgakekx, sherxVNige seVrida: \eng{good writers like Karanth} kAraMtaraMtaha oLeLxya leVKakaru. 
\num{4} (\sA\ joVDiyAgi, jotejoteyAgi iruva vasutxgaLa \vi parasapxra) oMdaraMte inonxMdu iruva: \eng{like mother, like daughter} tAyiyaMta magaLu; tAyi heVgidAdxLoV magaLU aMteyeV idAdxLe. 
\num{5} anuguNavAgiruva; savxBAvakekx -- takakxMte, anurUpavAgi iruva: \eng{that is like your impudence} adu ninanx dhASaTxyXRkekx takakxMtide. \eng{it was like him to think of himself last} tananx viSayavanunx koneyalilx yoVcisuvudu avana savxBAvakekx anuguNavAgitutx. \eng{it is not like them to be late} taDavAgi baruvudu avara savxBAvavalalx. 
\num{6} (yAvudanenxV mADalu yA paDeyalu) takakx sithxtiyalilx yA sUkatx manoVBAvadalilx iruva: \eng{feel like working} kelasa mADabeVkenisutatxde. \eng{felt like a cup of tea} oMdu loVTA TiV beVkinisitu. 
\num{7} (iruvaMte, AguvaMte) kANuva: \eng{looks like lasting} bALike baruvaMte kANutatxde. 
\num{8} (\pArxparx\ yA \AmA) saMBavaniVyavAda: \eng{as like as not} AgalUbahudu AgadiralU bahudu. \eng{like enough} pArxyashaH bahushaH.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{a critic like you} ninanxMtha vimashaRka.

\num{3} \eng{be nothing like} (yAva vidhadalUlx) samAnavAgilalxdiru yA hoVlikeyilalxdiru yA sAkaSiTxlalxdiru. 
\num{4} \eng{be (}\engit{or} \eng{have) like to do} mADuvudaralilxru; mADuva parxyatanxdalilxru. 
\num{5} \eng{had like to have done} (\pArxparx, \AmA) inenxVnu mADibiDuvudaralilxdedx. 
\num{6} \eng{like father, like son} taMdeyaMte maga. 
\num{7} \eng{like master, like man} daNiyaMte ALu; yathA rAjA tathA parxjAH.

\num{9} \eng{like that} (Aga tAneV noVDidudara, heVLidudara) hAge; aMte; adaraMte; A riVti; A parxkAravAgi. 
\num{10} \eng{look like} (yAvudoV oMdaraMte) kANu; toVru.

\bentry
\word[line(1)]{line}
\pron{leYnf}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (meVlemxY meVle eLeda) reVKe; gere; sAlu; paMkitx; giVru: \eng{drew a line} oMdu gere eLeda. 
\num{2} reVKana; reVKA parxyoVga; reVKana kaleyalilx geregaLa baLake, \kanmu\ nakAsegArike yA ububx citarxNagaLalilx baLake: \eng{boldness of line} reVKeya sapxSaTxte. \eng{purity of line} reVKAshudidhx; reVKeya shudadhxte, sapxSaTxte. 
\num{3} gurutu mADida reVKeyanunx hoVluva -- gere, sAlu, sukukx, baNaNxda paTeTx, kUDuholigeya reVKe, uLumeya jADu. 
\numi{4} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\saM) sAthxyiV reVKe; \sA\ aidu sAthxyiV reVKegaLa vinAyxsadalilx oMdu aDaDxgere. 
\alnum{b} (vAdayxda yA hADugArikeya rAgavinAyxsada) nAdaparxsAtxra; savxraparxsAtxra yA dhavxniparxsAtxra; savxragaLa yA dhavxnigaLa sherxVNi. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{5} (\ga) 
\banum
\alnum{a} saraLa yA vakarx -- reVKe, gere; udadx mAtarx idudx agalavilalxdiruva neVravAda yA vakarxvAda jAyxmitiVya Akaqti. 
\alnum{b} calisutitxruva oMdu biMdu racisuva Akaqti. 
\alnum{c} halavAru biMdugaLanunx seVrisi eLeda gere. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} rUpareVKe; Akaqti, AkAra, bAhayx, hora -- reVKe: \eng{admired the sculpture's clean lines} shilapxda sapxSaTx rUpareVKeyanunx parxshaMsisida. 
\num{7} muKa(lakaSxNa) reVKe: \eng{the savage lines of his mouth} kUrxra savxBAva sUcisuva avana bAyiya (rUpa)reVKegaLu. avana bAyiya kUrxra (rUpa)reVKegaLu. 
\num{8} (nakeSx yA gArxphfna \vi) nidiRSaTxvAda sAmAnayx guNagaLuLaLx biMdugaLanenxlalx seVrisida vakarxreVKe. 
\num{9} miti; elelx; meVre; gaDi; siVmA(reVKe): \eng{draw the line} miti gotutxmADu; meVre hAku. 
\num{10} (ATagaLa \vi) (ATada aMgaLada, parxdeVshada yA avugaLa visheVSa BAgagaLa elelxgaLanunx, paMdayxdalilx pArxraMBa yA mukAtxyada gaDiyanunx gurutisuva) elelxgere. 
\num{11} lekakxda gere; jamA KacuR gere; lekakxda pusatxkadalilx jamA KacuR KAtegaLanunx viMgaDisuva elelx yA gere. 
\num{12} (vayxkitxgaLa, vasutxgaLa) sAlu; paMkitx; saraNi; sherxVNi: \eng{assembly line} joVDaNe taMDa, sAlu; utapxnanxvoMdanunx karxmavAda haMtagaLalilx sidadhxgoLisalu irisida yaMtarxgaLa matutx kelasagArara sAlu, taMDa. 
\num{13} dikukx; dishe; kaDe: \eng{the line of march} sAguva dikukx. 
\num{14} (\ame) kUyx; saradiya sAlu: \eng{stand in line} kUyx(nalilx) nilulx. 
\num{15} (puTadalilx, vataRmAna patirxkeyalilx padagaLa) sAlu; paMkitx. 
\num{16} (padayxda oMdu) pAda; caraNa; paMkitx; sAlu. 
\numi{17} (\bava dalilx) 
\banum
\alnum{a} kavana; padayx. 
\alnum{b} (\birx) nidiRSaTx saMKeyxya padayx sAlugaLu; viSayada yA vayxkitxya meVle bareda padayxda sAlugaLu: \eng{100 lines} nUru padayx paMkitxgaLu. 
\alnum{c} naTana, pAtarxda -- mAtugaLu, sAlugaLu, paMkitx. 
\alnum{d} shikeSx paMkitxgaLu; shikeSxsAlugaLu; shAleyalilx shikeSxyAgi bareyabeVkAda nidiRSaTx parxmANada paThayxBAga \mo vu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{18} ciVTi; kirupatarx; oMderaDu sAlu: \eng{drop me a line} oMdu sAlu patarx bare. \eng{just a line to tell you} ninage tiLisalu oMdu paMkitx. 
\num{19} (\bava dalilx) = \hyperref{kandict_m.pdf}{M}{marriage lines}{marriage lines}. 
\num{20} (ALa kaMDu hiDiyuvudu, dUra aLeyuvudu, maTaTx noVDuvudu, \mo vugaLigAgi baLasuva) dAra, huri, horaji, hagagx, taMti, \mo vugaLa -- tuMDu; \kanmu\ miVnu gALada hagagx yA baTeTx oNagisalu upayoVgisuva hagagx. 
\num{21} (TeliphoVnina yA TeligArxphfna) leYnu; taMti yA taMti horaji. 
\num{22} leYnu; taMti saMpakaR; TeliphoVnf yA TeligArxphf taMti mUlaka paDeyuva saMpakaR: \eng{ the line is bad} (TeliphoVnf yA TeligArxphf) taMti(saMpakaR) keTiTxde, leYnf keTiTxde: \eng{am trying to get a line} taMti saMpakaR paDeyalu parxyatinxsutitxdedxVne. 
\num{23} reYlumAgaR; reYlu hAdi: \eng{up line} (koTaTx koneya parxdhAna nilAdxNakekx) hoVguva reYlu hAdi. \eng{down line} (koTaTx koneya parxdhAna nilAdxNadiMda) baruva reYlu hAdi. 
\num{24} reYlu vayxvasethxya oMdu shAKe yA oMdu ADaLita maMDaliya keYkeLagiruva iDiV vayxvasethx: \eng{main, branch, loopline} parxdhAna shAKe, upashAKe, kuNike shAKe. \eng{Southern line} dakiSxNa valayada (reYlevx) vayxvasethx. 
\num{25} (nidiRSaTx sathxLagaLa madheyx karxmavAgi ODADuva ja{ha}ju, basusx, vimAna, \mo vugaLa) sherxVNi; saraNi; taMDa; guMpu: \eng{shipping line} haDagu sArige taMDa; ja{ha}ju (sArige) saMsethx. 
\numi{26} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (kAlAnukarxmadalilx baruva vayxkitxgaLa) paMkitx; sherxVNi; saMtati; paraMpare; anukarxma: \eng{male, female, direct, etc. line} gaMDu, heNuNx, neVra, \mo\ saMtati. \eng{a long line of craftsmen} kushalakamiRgaLa diVGaR paraMpare. \eng{next in line to the throne} anukarxmadalilx siMhAsanakekx muMdinavanu. 
\alnum{b} vaMsha; kula; kuTuMba; manetana; buDakaTuTx; saMtati: \eng{comes of a good line} oLeLxya manetanadalilx huTiTxdavanu; satukxla parxsUta. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{27} (kAyaR, vataRne, AloVcane, \mo vugaLa) mAgaR; riVti; vidhAna; kirxye: \eng{did it along these lines} I riVtiyalilx, vidhAnadalilx mADida. \eng{don't take that line with me} nananx jote A karxma anusarisabeVDa. 
\num{28} kAyaRniVti: \eng{the party line} pakaSxda niVti. \eng{on the Conservative line} kanasxveRTivf niVtiya parxkAra.

\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum

\alnum{b} tuTi; adhara; tuTiyanunx hoVluva, tuTiyaMtha yAvudeV vasutx. 
\alnum{c}  = \hyperlink{labium}{labium}. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (baTaTxlu, pAterx, kuLi, gAya, \mo vugaLa) aMcu; arugu; \kanmu\ suriyalu anukUlavAguvaMte AkAra koTaTx BAga. 
\num{3} (\AmA) taleharaTe; adhikaparxsaMgitana; dhaqSaTxmAtu: (\ashi) (\kanmu): \eng{that is enough of your lip}! sAku ninanx taleharaTe!

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{escape one's lips} (mAtu \mo vu muMdAloVcaneyilalxde) tuTi dATi, miVri, jAri baru. 
\hypertarget{lip pagu2}{} 
\num{2} \eng{lick one's lips} (AhArada ruci saviyutAtx yA adara saviya niriVkaSxNeyalilx-\kanmu\ sashabadxvAgi) tuTi nekukx, savariko; capapxrisu; loTeTx hoDe(\rUpa\ saha). 
\num{3} \eng{smack one's lips} = \hyperlink{lip pagu2}{?pagu? \((2)\)}. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{bite one's lip} (keraLidAga, udevxVgavanunx aDagisuvAga, naguvanunx taDeyuvAga) avuDu, tuTi -- kacucx: \eng{he was angry, but bit his lip in order to avoid a scene} avanige siTuTx baMdarU raMpavanunx tapipxsalu tuTi kacicxdanu. 
\num{2} \eng{curl one's lip} (tirasAkxra sUcisalu) tuTi -- suruTisu, soTaTxge mADu, maDacu, suruLi sututx. 
\num{3} \eng{hang on a person's lips} tuTige joVtu biVLu; (vayxkitxya parxti mAtanUnx) pUjayx BAvaneyiMda yA atayxMta AsakitxyiMda Alisu. keVLu: \eng{the students hung on the lips of the new teacher} vidAyxthiRgaLu hosa upAdhAyxyaru ADida parxti mAtanUnx atayxMta AsakitxyiMda, gwravadiMda keVLidaru. 
\num{4} \eng{hang one's lip} (apamAnavAdAga yA avamAnadiMda) tuTi -- iLibiDu, joVlu biDu. 
\num{5} \eng{pass a person's lips} tuTi -- hokikxru, parxveVshisiru; tiMdiru, kuDidiru, mAtADiru \mo. 
\hyperdef{L}{lip(1) nuga(6)}{} 
\num{6} \eng{stiff upper lip} dheYyaR; sethxYyaR; dhaqti; seYraNe; haTa: \eng{throughout the crisis they kept a stiff upper lip} bikakxTiTxnudadxkUkx avaru sethxYyaR tALidadxru. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\num{2} tananx badukinalilx -- toVrisu, aBivayxkitxsu: \eng{ live a lie} suLuLx (baduku) baduku; suLuLx jiVvana naDesu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} jiVvadiMdiru; jiVvisiru; jiVvisu; baduku; badukiru; bALu; pArxNaviru; pArxNadiMdiru; pArxNiyAgi yA sasayxvAgi jiVvahoMdiru. 
\num{2} (tiMdu, Asharxyisi yA AdhArada meVle) jiVvisu; baduku; jiVvayApane mADu; pArxNadhAraNe mADu: \eng{lives on fruit} haNiNxna meVle, haNuNx tiMdu -- jiVvisutAtxne. \eng{lives upon his wife's earnings} heMDatiya saMpAdaneya meVle badukutitxdAdxne. 
\num{3} badukigAgi Asharxyisu; uLivigAgi avalaMbisiru: \eng{lives on income from investments} (badukige) baMDavALada AdAyavanunx avalaMbisidAdxne. \eng{lives off the family property} manetanada Asitxya meVle badukidAdxne, jiVvisidAdxne. 
\num{4} (\rUpa) (tananx sAthxna matutx gwravagaLanunx Asharxyisi, avugaLa AdhArada meVle) baduku; jiVvisu: \eng{lives on his reputation} avana hesarina parxsididhxya (balada) meVle badukutAtxne, jiVvana sAgisutAtxne. 
\num{5} (budidhx cAtuyaR, duDime, \mo vugaLa mUlaka) jiVvanoVpAya saMpAdisu; jiVvike gaLisu; tananx budidhxvaMtikeyiMda (kelavu sala moVsa mAgaRgaLiMda) jiVvisu. 
\num{6} naDeduko; naDavaLikeyalilx -- anusarisu, pAlisu; oMdu visheVSa riVtiyalilx -- baduku, bALu, jiVvisu: \eng{live quietly} shAMtavAgi baduku. \eng{live honestly} pArxmANikateyiMda bALu. \eng{live viciously} keTaTxjiVvana naDesu. \eng{live like a saint} saMtanaMte bALu. 
\num{7} tananx havAyxsagaLu, KacuR, AhAra, \mo vugaLanunx -- vayxvasethx mADiko, EpARTu mADi jiVvisu: \eng{live modestly} ADaMbara rahitavAgi jiVvisu. 
\num{8} vAsisu; vAsa mADu; tananx kAyaM vAsasathxLa mADikoMDiru yA hoMdiru: \eng{live in Mysore} meYsUrinalilx vAsamADu. \eng{live abroad} videVshadalilx vAsa mADu. 
\num{9} (vayxkitxya yA vasutxvina \vi) badukiru; uLidiru; jiVvaMtavAgiru; jiVva hiDidukoMDiru; usiriTuTxkoMDiru; pArxNa uLisikoMDiru: \eng{his memory lives} avana nenapu uLidide, jiVvaMtavAgide. \eng{the patient cannot live} roVgi uLiyalAra. \eng{lived to see his children's children} tananx momamxkakxLanunx noVDuvavaregU badukidadx. 
\num{10} (haDagu \mo vugaLa \vi) nAshavAgade uLi; vinAshadiMda tapipxsikoMDiru: \eng{nothing could live afloat} yAvudU vinAshadiMda tapipxsikoMDu uLiyuvaMtiralilalx. 
\num{11} badukanunx pUNaRvAgi yA tiVvarxvAgi savi; jiVvanada suKa saMtoVSagaLanunx tiVvarxvAgi yA saMpUNaRvAgi anuBavisu; pUtiR suKa paDu; KuSiyAgi bALu: \eng{at forty she was just beginning to live} avaLu tananx nalavatatxneya vaSaRdalilx jiVvanada suKa saMtoVSagaLanunx anuBavisalu pArxraMBisidadxLu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{live a lie} suLuLx jiVvana naDesu; suLuLx bALu baduku; suLaLxnunx nijaveMdu mADu: \eng{she lived a lie for 20 years pretending to be his wife} avana heMDati eMdu naTisutAtx \eng{20} vaSaR avaLu suLuLx jiVvana naDesidaLu. 
\num{2} \eng{live and learn} (hosa yA aniriVkiSxta anuBavada bagegx AshacxyaRpaTuTx mAtanADuvAga baLasuva parxyoVga) jiVvanadalilx kaliyabeVkAdadudx bahaLa ide; badukinalilx kaliyabeVkAdadudx beVkAdaSiTxde; badukinalilx udadxkUkx hosa viSayagaLanunx kaliyutAtx hoVgu, kaliyutitxru; kaliyutAtx baduku; badukidudx budidhx kali. 
\num{3} \eng{live and let live} niVnU baduku, itararanunx badukalu biDu; niVnu sahane toVrisi, itararU parxtiyAgi sahane toVruvaMte mADu; niVnu itarariMda niriVkiSxsuva sahAnuBUti, sahanegaLanunx itarara viSayadalUlx toVru. 
\num{4} \eng{live beyond one's means} saMpAdisuvudakikxMta hecucx KacuR mADu; AdAyakikxMta hecucx vecacx mADu. 
\num{5} \eng{live by doing (something)} yAvudanenxV mADutAtx jiVvanoVpAya gaLisu. 
\num{6} \eng{live for something} (yAvudoV oMdu) gurigAgi, dheyxVyakAkxgi jiVvisu, baduku: \eng{lives for his work} tananx kelasakAkxgi badukidAdxne. 
\numi{7} \eng{live in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\birx) (aMgaDi matutx mane kelasagAraru \mo vara \vi) kelasa mADuva kaDeyeV vAsisu; oLage vAsisu. 
\alnum{b} (koThaDi \mo vanunx) vAsakAkxgi -- baLasu, upayoVgisu: \eng{the veranda was more lived in than the sitting room} vAsakAkxgi divAnaKAnegiMtalU hecAcxgi verAMDavanenxV baLasalAgitutx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{live in a small way} saraLa, mitajiVvana naDesu; savxlapx vecacxdalilx, ADaMbaravilalxde jiVvana mADu. 
\num{9} \eng{live in hope(s) (of something)} (yAvudaradoV) niriVkeSxyalilx baduku: \eng{live in hopes of better time to come} baruva oLeLxya kAlavanunx niriVkiSxsutAtx badukiru. 
\num{10} \eng{live in sin} (\gaparx\ yA \hA) (gaMDasina yA heMgasina \vi) (maduveyAgadidadxrU) gaMDaheMDiraMte bALu; dAMpatayx jiVvana naDesu. 
\num{11} \eng{live in the past} BUtakAladalilx baduku; hiMdina kAlada parisithxtigaLu, mwlayxgaLu, \mo vu badalAyisiyeV ilalxdaMte bALu. 
\num{12} \eng{live like a lord} veYBavada jiVvana naDesu. 
\numi{13} \eng{live on air} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gALi kuDidu baduku; nirAhAriyAgiru. 
\alnum{b} nirAhAriyAgiruvaMte -- kANu, toVru. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{14} \eng{live out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (kelasagAraru \mo vara \vi) kelasada sathxLadiMda beVre kaDe vAsamADu. 
\alnum{b} (apAya, kaSaTx, \mo vugaLiMda) pArAgu; tapipxsikoMDu uLi. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{15} \eng{live through} badukiru; jiVva uLisikoMDiru; yAvudoV oMdu Ada naMtaravU badukiru. 
\num{16} \eng{live to} badukuLi; uLidiru; badukiru: \eng{lived to a great age} bahaLa vayasisxnavaregU badukidadx. 
\num{17} \eng{live together} (\kanmu\ vivAhavAgada gaMDu heNuNx) oMdeV maneyalilxdudx leYMgika saMbaMdha iTuTxkoMDiru; oTiTxge iru, vAsisu; sahabALevx naDesu. 
\num{18} \eng{long live}! diVGARyuvAgali! cirAyuvAgali! (niSeThx toVruva udAgxra): \eng{long live the Republic} gaNarAjayx cirAyuvAgali. 
\numi{19} \eng{live well} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (maqSATxnanx BoVjana mADutatx) suKavAgi bALu; veYBoVgadiMda baduku; suKadiMda jiVvisu. 
\alnum{b} anukUla sithxtiyalilxru; sithxtivaMta bALu naDesu. 
\alnum{c} oLeLxya badukanunx baduku; sajijxVvana naDesu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{20} \eng{live with} 
\banum
\alnum{a} oTiTxge oMdeV maneyalilx vAsisu. 
\alnum{b} sahisiko; tALiko; ogigxsiko; hoMdiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{21} \eng{live within one's means} AdAyaviruvaSaTxralilx jiVvisu; saMpAdisuvudakikxMta kaDime vecacxmADu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\bmng

\alnum{b} adeV udedxVshakAkxgi baLasuva beVrAvudeV sAdhana. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} yAna dAKale; (veVgamApakadalilx sUcisidaMte haDagina munanxDeyU seVridaMte) haDagina yA vimAnada yAnadalilx naDeyuva ilalxve yAnada meVle parxBAva biVruva GaTanegaLa dAKale.

\emng

\noindent

\num{2} \eng{float like a log} koraDinaMte (nishecxVSaTxvAgi yA nisasxhAyakavAgi) teVlu. 
\num{3} \eng{lie like a log} koraDinaMte, dimimxyaMte (jaDavAgi, nisasxhAyakavAgi) bididxru.

\emng

\bentry
\word[look(1)]{look}
\pron{lukf}
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} noVDu; diTiTxsu; oMdara meVle kaNiNxDu: \eng{looked me in the eyes} nananxnunx diTiTxsi noVDida. 
\num{2} avaloVkisu; pariVkiSxsu; parishiVlisu: \eng{looked me through and through} nananxnunx (mamaR tiLidukoLuLxvaMte) pariVkiSxsi noVDida. 
\num{3} noVTadiMda (yAvudeV BAva \mo vanunx) -- vayxkatxpaDisu, parxkaTisu, toVrisu, bedarisu yA hedarisu: \eng{look compassion} karuNeyiMda noVDu. \eng{look death} kolulxvaMte noVDu. 
\num{4} noVDi, noVDuvudara mUlaka -- KacitapaDisiko, KAtari mADiko, nishicxtavAgi tiLiduko: \eng{look where we are} nAvu elilxdedxVveMdu noVDu, noVDi tiLiduko. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} noVDu; kANu; oMdu kaDege kaNuNx, daqSiTx -- tirugisu, harisu, hAyisu. 
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kaNiNxniMda -- arasu; huDuku; shoVdhane mADu: \eng{I'll look in the morning} nAnu beLigegx huDukutetxVne. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) manasisxnalilx -- shoVdhisu, vicAra mADu: \eng{instead of reforming others let us look at home} itararanunx sudhAraNe mADuva badalu namamxnenxV shoVdhisikoLoLxVNa. \eng{when one looks deeper} oLahokukx vicAra mADidare. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} parigaNisu; parishiVlisu; pariVkiSxsu; parAmashiRsu: \eng{we must look at the facts} nAvu satAyxMshagaLanunx parishiVlisabeVku. 
\num{4} huDuku; shoVdhisu; anevxVSisu: \eng{Columbus was looking for a shorter route to the East} kolaMbasanu pUvaR deVshagaLige inUnx hatitxrada mAgaRvanunx huDukutitxdadxnu. 
\num{5} niriVkiSxsu; idiru yA eduru noVDu; parxtiVkiSxsu: \eng{we look to greater advances in science} nAvu vijAcnxnadalilx inUnx hecicxna munanxDeyanunx niriVkiSxsutetxVve. 
\num{6} gamanisu; parigaNisu; gamanakoDu; gamanakoTuTx noVDu: \eng{way of looking at things} vasutxgaLanunx gamanisuva riVti. 
\num{7} (hAge, aMte, A riVti) kANu; toVru: \eng{look grave} gaMBiVravAgi kANu. \eng{look foolish} daDaDxnaMte toVru. \eng{look a fool} pedadxnaMte kANisu. 
\num{8} gamanisu; parigaNisu; gamanadalilxDu: \eng{look to the future} BaviSayxvanunx gamanadalilxDu. 
\hypertarget{look(1)9akirx}{} 
\num{9} ecacxrike vahisu; joVkeyiMdiru; huSArAgi noVDiko; usutxvAri vahisu: \eng{look to your manners} ninanx naDavaLikeya viSayadalilx ecacxrikeyiMdiru. \eng{look to your prisoner} ninanx baMdiyanunx joVkeyiMda noVDiko. 
\num{10} (vayxkitxya yA vasutxvina meVle) avalaMbisu; BaravaseyiDu; necucx; naMbu: \eng{all look to you for help} elalxrU sahAyakAkxgi ninanxnunx necicxkoMDidAdxre. 
\num{11} Ashisu; niriVkiSxsu; udedxVshisu; edurunoVDu: \eng{look to quiet in my old age} nananx mupipxnalilx nemamxdiyanunx edurunoVDutetxVne. 
\num{12} pariVkiSxsu; parishiVlisu; taniKe naDesu: \eng{the auditors are looking into the records} lekAkxdhikArigaLu dAKalegaLanunx taniKe naDesutitxdAdxre. 
\numi{13} (vasutxvina \vi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} yAvudeV dikikxge yA kaDege -- tirugiru, muKamADikoMDiru, aBimuKavAgiru. 
\alnum{b} yAvudeV kaDeya -- noVTa niVDuvaMtiru, daqshayx toVruvaMtiru: \eng{the window looks upon the street} kiTaki biVdiya kaDege teredide, biVdiyanunx toVrisutatxde; kiTakiyiMda biVdi kANisutatxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} jAgarUkanAgiru; KacitapaDisiko; KAtari mADikoMDiru. 
\num{15} bayasu; Ashisu; aMduko; niriVkiSxsu: \eng{am looking to finish this today} idanunx iMdu mugisabeVkeMdidedxVne, mugisabeVkeMdu aMdukoMDidedxVne. 
\num{16} hAgiruvaMte kANu; aMtiruvaMte toVru: \eng{look one's age} vayasisxge takakxMte, anuguNavAgi -- kANisu, toVru, kANu. \eng{look oneself again} matetx ceVtarisikoMDaMte kANu; matetx sudhArisidaMte toVru. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{look about} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kAyutitxru; niriVkiSxsutitxru. 
\alnum{b} huDuku; arasu; anevxVSisu: \eng{are you still looking about for a job} niVnu inUnx kelasa huDukutitxdidxVyA? 
\alnum{c} sutatxmutatx noVDu; sutatxlU -- daqSiTxharisu, kaNuNxhAyisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} \eng{look about one} 
\banum
\alnum{a} sutatxlU kaNuNxhAyisu; tananx sutatxmutatxNa parisithxtigaLanunx pariVkiSxsu. 
\alnum{b} (yoVjane \mo vanunx) sAvakAshavAgi, nidhAnavAgi -- mADu; mADalu avasarapaDabeVDa. 
\alnum{c} ecacxrikeyiMdiru; jAgarxte vahisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{3} \eng{look after} 
\banum
\alnum{a} noVDiko; salahu; rakiSxsu; kApADu; joVpAna mADu. 
\alnum{b} kaNiNxniMda -- anusarisu, hiMbAlisu. 
\alnum{c} huDuku; arasu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{4} \eng{look ahead.} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (doVNi naDesuvavana \vi) (\kanmu\ vidhi rUpadalilx) (doVNi etatx sAgutitxdeyeMdu tiLiyalu) tirugi, sutatx -- noVDu. 
\alnum{b} muMdAguvudanunx AloVcisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{look as if} hAgiruvaMte toVru; noVDidare irabahudeVnoV -- eMbaMte kANu yA eMba naMbike huTiTxsu: \eng{it looks as if he's gone} avanu horaTuhoVdaMte kANutatxde. 
\numi{6} \eng{look at} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (oMdanunx) noVDu. 
\alnum{b} (oMdakekx) gamanakoDu. 
\alnum{c} pariVkiSxsu; parishiVlisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{7} \eng{look back} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gatisiruvudanunx ciMtisu; yAvudoV naDeduhoVda GaTaneya kaDege manasusx tirugisu; AgihoVgiruvudanunx kuritu yoVcisu: \eng{looking back on our school days} namamx shAleya dinagaLanunx kuritu yoVcisidAga. 
\alnum{b} (\sA\ niSeVdhAthaRkadoDane) (keYgoMDa kAyaR \mo vugaLa \vi) muMduvariyadiru; munanxDeyadiru; parxgati hoMdadiru; muMduvariyade niMtubiDu: \eng{since then he has never looked back} aMdiniMda avanu hiMdakekx noVDilalx (oMdeV samane munanxDe sAdhisidAdxne). 
\alnum{c} (\birx) matotxmemx BeVTiniVDu. 
\alnum{d} nene; samxrisu; jAcnxpisiko; jAcnxpakakekx, nenapige -- taMduko. 
\alnum{e} (keYkoMDa kAyaRda \vi) (\sA\ niSeVdhAthaRkadalilx) hiMjari; hiMdeVTu hoDe; aremanasisxniMdiru; udAsiVnaBAva tALu; dheYyaR, utAsxha -- kugugx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{look bad} = \hyperlink{look pagu13}{?pagu? \((13)\)}. 
\numi{9} \eng{look down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} noVTadiMda aDagisu; daqSiTxyiMdaleV -- gelulx, adhiVna mADiko: \eng{never could look the boy down} A huDugananunx kaNiNxniMda (noVTadiMda) aDagisalu sAdhayxveV Agalilalx. 
\alnum{b} (vANijayx) bele -- iLi, bidudxhoVgu, kugugx: \eng{when the shares look down} SeVrugaLa belegaLu iLimuKavAdAga. 
\alnum{c} (\rUpa) tAnu sherxVSaThxneMdu BAvisu; itararanunx kaDegaNisu; kiVLAgi kANu; tirasAkxradiMda noVDu: \eng{they look down on all foreigners} avaru elAlx videVshiyaranUnx kaDegaNisutAtxre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{look for} \hyperref{kandict_t.pdf}{T}{trouble(2) pagu(1)}{$^2$trouble}. 
\num{11} \eng{look forward to} (kAturadiMda yA visheVSa BAvanegaLiMda, aniriVkiSxta GaTaneyanunx) eduru noVDu; niriVkiSxsu; kAyu: \eng{we are looking forward to seeing you again} nAvu nimamxnunx punaH noVDuva niriVkeSxyalilxdedxVve. 
\num{12} \eng{look good} cenAnxgiruvaMte, susithxtiyalilxruvaMte -- kANisu, toVru. 
\hypertarget{look pagu13}{} 
\numi{13} \eng{look ill} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (vasutxgaLa \vi) hadageTiTxruva hAge kANu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} \eng{look in} hokukxhoVgu; BeVTimADu; noVDibA: \eng{the doctor will look in again this evening} veYdayxru I saMje matetx noVDikoMDu hoVgutAtxre (BeVTi niVDuvaru). 
\numi{15} \eng{look into} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (peTiTxge \mo vugaLa) oLaBAgavanunx pariVkiSxsu. 
\alnum{b} parishiVlisu; pariVkiSxsu; taniKe mADu; shoVdhisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{16} \eng{look like} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hoVlu; sadaqshavAgiru; aMtiru; aMte -- kANu, toVru; hoVlikeyiru. 
\alnum{b} (\birx) aMte toVru; eMdu anisu: \eng{they look like winning} avaru gelulxtAtxreMdu anisutatxde. 
\alnum{c} kANu; hedarisu yA Baravase niVDu: \eng{it looks like rain} maLe baruvaMte kANutatxde.

\eanum
\numie
\numi{17} \eng{look on} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (eMdu) kANu; BAvisu; gaNisu; noVDu; eNisu: \eng{looks on you as a friend} ninanxnunx senxVhitaneMdu BAvisutAtxne. \eng{looked on them with disfavour} avaranunx devxVSadiMda kaMDa. 
\alnum{b} (sumamxne) noVDutitxru; perxVkaSxkanAgiru; BAgavahisadiru: \eng{why don't you play cricket instead of just looking on?} kirxkeTf ATavanunx sumamxne noVDuva badalu niVnu yAke ADabAradu? 
\alnum{c} (sathxLa, koVNe, \mo vugaLa \vi) daqshayx toVru; noVTa kANisu: \eng{my bedroom looks on (to) the garden} nananx malaguva koVNeyiMda toVTa kANisutatxde.

\numie
\num{18} \eng{look on with} (matotxbabxnu OdutitxruvAgaleV) pusatxka \mo vanunx tAnU joteyalilx noVDu, Odu: \eng{may I look on with you} ninonxDaneyeV nAnu noVDaleV (OdaleV)? 
\numi{19} \eng{look out} 
\banum

\alnum{c} ecacxrikeyiMdiru; jAgarUkateyiMdiru; huSArAgiru: \eng{you had better look out, she is in a rage} avaLu bahaLa siTiTxnalilxdAdxLe, niVnu huSArAgiruvudu meVlu. 
\alnum{d} huDuki koDu: \eng{shall look out one for you} ninage oMdu huDuki koDutetxVne. \eng{look out some old clothes for poor relations} baDa neMTarigAgi kelavu haLeV baTeTxgaLanunx huDuki tA. 
\alnum{e} (niriVkiSxta vayxkitxgAgi) kaNuNx teredukoMDiru; noVDutitxru; gamana harisiru: \eng{will you go to the station and look out for my son?} niVnu nilAdxNakekx hoVgi nananx maga baMdaneV eMdu noVDutitxVyA?

\numie
\numi{20} \eng{look over}

\alnum{b} (dAKale \mo vanunx) (\kanmu) sUthxlavAgi -- noVDu, pariVkiSxsu, taniKe mADu: \eng{shall look it over} sUthxlavAgi pariVkiSxsutetxVne.

\numie
\numi{21} \eng{look round}

\alnum{b} oMdu sathxLada sAvxrasayxvAda viSayagaLanunx, sathxLagaLanunx parishiVlisu, noVDu: \eng{you must come and look round sometime} niVnu baMdu yavAgalAdarU elalx sAvxrasayxvAda sathxLagaLanunx noVDabeVku. 
\alnum{c} (\rUpa) sutatxmutatx noVDu; hiMdumuMdu yoVcisu; pUvARpara AloVcisu; \kanmu\ yAvudeV mAgaRvanunx nidhaRrisalu, sAdhAyxsAdhayxtegaLu \mo vanunx parishiVlisu, viveVcisu: \eng{looked round before deciding which car to purchase} yAva kAranunx koLaLxbeVkeMdu tiVmARnisuva munanx elAlx sAdhayxtegaLanunx kuritu yoVciside.

\numie

\numie
\num{23} \eng{looks to be} aninxsutatxde; kANutatxde; toVrutatxde: \eng{looks to be good} oLeLxyavanaMte kANutAtxne. 
\numi{24} \eng{look through}

\alnum{b} (naTaneyanunx yA bUTATikeyavananunx) mamaR tiLiyuvaMte, oLahokukx, daqSiTxhAyisi, tiVkaSxNXdaqSiTxyiMda noVDu: \eng{he looks quite through the deeds of men} avanu manuSayxra kaqtayxgaLanunx pUtiR oLahokukx noVDutAtxne. 
\alnum{c} noVDade iruvaMte naTisi kaDegaNisu; noVDidarU noVDadaMtiru: \eng{I waved, but you just looked through me} nAnu keYyADiside, Adare niVnu noVDidarU noVDade iruvaMte idedx. 
\alnum{d} kANu; kANisikoLuLx; goVcarisu; parxkaTisiko; vayxkatxvAgu: \eng{his greed looks through his eyes} avana durAshe avana kaNuNxgaLalilx kANutatxde. 
\alnum{e} samagarxvAgi, saMpUNaRvAgi, pUtiR - noVDu; \kanmu\ AmUlAgarxvAgi, kUlaMkaSavAgi, AdayxMtavAgi -- parishiVlisu: \eng{if one looks through Indian history} yArAdarU BAratada itihAsavanunx samagarxvAgi noVDidare.

\banum
